intro: Oreocarya torva, commonly known as the Sierra lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Oreocarya torva is adapted to cold, mountainous climates and is often found in alpine meadows and subalpine zones.
